Title:
Phaeocalicium polyporaeum (Mycocaliciaceae, Ascomycota) new
to Japan
Keywords:
Calicioid fungus, eastern Asia, ITS rDNA, nrLSU,
Trichaptum abietinum, taxonomy
Abstract:
Phaeocalicium polyporaeum, a non-lichenized calicioid
fungus, is reported as new to Japan. It was found on the surface of
Trichaptum abietinum, a small polyporous fungus, growing on the trunks
of Pinus densiflora and Abies sp. at elevation 1,348 m in Nagano
Prefecture, central Japan. The ITS rDNA and nrLSU sequences were
obtained from the specimens of Japan and Far East Russia, in which the
differences were one transition and one indel for ITS rDNA (ITS1 region)
and one transition for nrLSU (D1/D2 region). A molecular phylogenetic
tree for the related taxa based on the ITS rDNA sequences is also
shown.
